an7.92:1.1: “Mendicants, it’s by being impeccably remote from seven things that you become a perfected one.
an7.92:1.3: Substantialist view, doubt, misapprehension of precepts and observances, greed, hate, delusion, and conceit.
an7.92:1.4: It’s because of being impeccably remote from these seven things that you become a perfected one.”
